title: UX Designer & Content Writer - 100% remote
description:
Vi söker en erfaren UX Designer & Content Writer som vill vara med och förvandla en global HR Knowledge Base till en världsledande självserviceupplevelse för chefer och medarbetare. Uppdraget kombinerar innehållsstrategi med användarupplevelse och innebär att du arbetar både kreativt och strukturerat för att göra komplex information enkel, tillgänglig och engagerande.


Du kommer att skapa en intuitiv informationsstruktur som stödjer enkel navigering och effektiv sökning – samtidigt som du lägger grunden för framtida automatisering, AI och chatbot-funktionalitet. Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med HR-experter, utvecklare och AI-specialister för att etablera tydliga contentstandarder, mallar och styrning för långsiktig förvaltning och tillväxt.


**Uppdraget**  

Geografisk placering: Remote  

Omfattning: 100%  

Startdatum: 2025-11-03  

Slutdatum: 2027-10-29

**Dina uppgifter**  

Analysera och omarbeta befintligt innehåll i HR Knowledge Base  

Utforma en användarcentrerad informationsarkitektur  

Säkerställa tydlig, konsekvent och tillgänglig kommunikation  

Utveckla contentstandarder, mallar och riktlinjer  

Samarbeta tvärfunktionellt med HR, utveckling och AI-team  

Bidra till att skapa en skalbar kunskapsstruktur för framtiden

**Kvalifikationer**  

Erfarenhet av ServiceNow HRSD eller liknande HR-plattformar  

Mycket goda kunskaper inom UX writing och informationsarkitektur  

Erfarenhet av content strategy och knowledge management  

Förståelse för AI-driven sök och chatbotintegration  

Flytande på engelska  

God kommunikationsförmåga och känsla för struktur och tonalitet

  

Sway Sourcing är en innovativ rekryteringspartner som specialiserar sig på att matcha rätt talang med rätt företag – snabbt och effektivt. Vårt huvudfokus ligger inom Ekonomi, Administration, HR, Marknad och IT, men vi har även den breda expertis och flexibilitet som krävs för att leverera skräddarsydda rekryteringslösningar inom alla branscher.


Trots att vi är en relativt ny aktör har vi redan byggt förtroende hos många av Sveriges största företag och arbetar både nationellt och internationellt. Med baser i Sverige och Spanien erbjuder vi en unik kombination av lokal expertis och global räckvidd. Vårt starka nätverk och djupa branschinsikter gör oss till en självklar partner för företag som vill ligga steget före i sin rekrytering.

title: Webbdesigner - timanställning
description:
**Vill du vara med och skapa Sveriges mest användarvänliga vårdupplevelse online?**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Hos oss på Svea KBT / Elly Care får du arbeta med design och digitala upplevelser som faktiskt påverkar människors liv — på riktigt.

### **Om rollen**


Som Webbdesigner blir du en nyckelperson i hur människor upplever vår digitala närvaro. Din uppgift är att skapa webbsidor som inte bara ser fantastiska ut — utan också känns intuitiva, tillgängliga och engagerande.


Du kommer bland annat att:

* Designa användarvänliga webbsidor med hög visuell kvalitet


Skapa moderna UI- och UX-lösningar i Figma — från idé till färdig design
* Självständigt bygga sidor i WordPress och Gutenberg
* Samarbeta med marknads-, kommunikations- och utvecklingsteam för att skapa helhetsupplevelser som driver konvertering och engagemang
* Bidra till vår designstrategi och sätta en hög standard för form och funktion
  
* 

  

### **Vi söker dig som har:**

#### **Tekniska färdigheter**

* Mycket god känsla för design och form — du vet hur en riktigt bra webbsida ska se ut och kännas
* Stark förståelse för UX och UI
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Figma — du arbetar effektivt och självständigt i verktyget
* God vana att bygga sidor i WordPress och Gutenberg
* Mycket goda kunskaper i HTML och CSS
* Förmåga att kommunicera tydligt och arbeta med flera stakeholders samtidigt

#### **Personliga egenskaper**

* Du är strukturerad och effektiv i ditt arbete
* Du har ett öga för detaljer men tappar aldrig bort helheten
* Du är kommunikativ, prestigelös och gillar att samarbeta
* Du trivs i en miljö där det händer mycket och där din insats märks

### **Det är ett plus om du också:**

* Är duktig på annan typ av design, t.ex. sociala medier, nyhetsbrev eller trycksaker
* Kan enklare frontendkodning utöver HTML/CSS (t.ex. JavaScript)

### **Arbetsprov kommer att vara en del av rekryteringsprocessen**


Som en del i rekryteringsprocessen kommer kandidater att få utföra arbetsprover. Vi vill också se tidigare arbetsprover som du har gjort. Inkludera därför minst 3 hemsidor som du har designat själv. Beskriv noggrannt vad du har gjort på varje hemsida och vad som var målet med designen.

### **Om Svea KBT & Elly Care**


Vi är en av Sveriges mest snabbväxande aktörer inom psykisk hälsa. Vår mission är att skapa Bästa patientresan — en vårdupplevelse som är sömlös, empatisk och effektiv.  

Vi arbetar med KBT, psykologisk behandling och NPF-utredningar, både fysiskt och digitalt.


Som Webbdesigner hos oss hjälper du människor att hitta rätt hjälp i rätt tid — genom genomtänkt design och smarta digitala lösningar.

### **Vi erbjuder**

* En varm, prestigelös och kreativ arbetskultur
* Flexibilitet i arbetstid och arbetsplats
* Möjlighet att påverka designstrategin och skapa verklig samhällsnytta
* Ett engagerat team som gillar att testa nytt, dela kunskap och bygga något viktigt tillsammans

### **Praktisk information**

* Anställningsform: Timanställning - **det är inte aktuellt med fakturering eller frilansarbete. Endast timanställning är aktuellt.**
* Omfattning: Enligt överenskommelse
* Ort: Stockholm (distansarbete kan förekomma)
* Kontakt: patrik.bergqvist@sveakbt.se felix.israelsson@sveakbt.se
* Ansökan: Skicka gärna in så snart som möjligt – urval sker löpande
* Bifoga: Exempel på webbplatser och designprojekt du arbetat med (gärna i Figma eller WordPress)

title: Product Owner (Retail)
description:
This is a fantastic opportunity to shape the future of one of the largest and most important digital services in Sweden.


At Kivra, we are building services that connect over 6 million people with more than 50 000 senders in both the private and public sector. We provide a safe and accessible digital infrastructure that everyone in Sweden can trust and use. One of Kivra's most appreciated services is receipts. Millions of our users receive digital receipts in Kivra every month and the numbers are growing rapidly.

**About the role**

As Product Owner, you’ll lead Kivra’s Receipt product, including our retail offering, to drive our mission of becoming the leading infrastructure for digital receipts. This is a strategically important area for Kivra, where your work will directly shape our future direction.


Part of this role is to assess value, develop and prioritise stories, epics, and themes to ensure work aligns with product strategy. As a Product Owner you will also:

* Own team objectives and key results.
* Develop and maintain appropriate tracking and reporting of product performance post-launch to evaluate a future investment.
* Manage the product backlog.
* Oversee all stages of product creation including design and development.
* Act as an ambassador for the product internally and externally and as the primary contact for queries related to the product area.


We strongly believe that working in autonomous cross-functional teams consisting of UX designers, software engineers and analysts is the best way to develop products. You will be at the very heart of that process. Together with the team you will be responsible to deeply understand the needs of our users and customers and translate them into services that the team will develop.


As a Product Owner, you will be a part of the business area “Emerging business” and report to our CCO Emerging business. In your daily work you will collaborate very closely with other teams at Kivra, such as Sales, Customer Service, Marketing and Legal & Compliance.

**About you**

In order to thrive and succeed in this role, we believe that:


* You have 5+ years of experience within software product management, leading a cross-functional team.
* You have sharp analytical and problem-solving skills, and are used to work with data and insights for understanding and measuring the outcome.
* You have a customer-centric approach for product prioritisation
* You have good interpersonal communication skills and can work as a bridge between stakeholders, tech and other product teams.
* You possess the courage and conviction to set a clear direction while handling stakeholder opinions
* You have the ability to innovate creative solutions for complex problems by leading a high-performing team.
* You have excellent communication skills in Swedish and English.
* You are a team player, just like us!

At Kivra we value great attitude. It’s as simple as that! We believe that you, just like us, like working hands-on in a dynamic environment where short feedback loops, fast decision making and longer term strategy are part of the challenge.

**We offer**


Kivra offers a role in a caring and committed team, in a company that is growing and continuously innovating. You’ll join a warm and friendly culture that thrives on collaboration and teamwork. You will be involved in shaping and influencing a product currently used by more than half of Sweden’s population.


We offer competitive remuneration and great benefits. We offer a hybrid way of working where working from home is of course accepted, however we believe we create better products by meeting in person and the clear majority of your work is expected to be in our vibrant office located in central Stockholm.


**How to apply**


Easy peasy, just send in your CV and cover letter as soon as possible. If you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact Sarah Ohlsson, Talent Acquisition Partner at sarah.ohlsson@kivra.com.

title: E-commerce & CRM Lead
description:
### **About the Role**


We’re looking for a dynamic and hands-on **E-commerce and CRM Lead** to take end-to-end ownership of Hem’s digital store and catalogue - hem.com and pro.hem.com. You’ll drive sales growth, conversion, and retention across all online customer segments, including design-conscious individuals and trade professionals (Hem Pro), while delivering a best-in-class brand experience online with visuals and references for our B2B clients.

### **Your Responsibilities**

**Digital Store Operations**

* Oversee product uploads, merchandising, and on-site messaging across hem.com and Hem Pro
* Collaborate closely with Head of B2B Project Sales to align visuals and language with the needs of our digital first product catalogue
* Manage and execute digital campaigns and sales events, from discount setup and messaging to performance tracking
* Act as project owner and coordinator towards with Hem’s developers and tech partners to optimize our headless e-commerce stack - prioritizing development needs for performance and UX
* Ensure site updates align with product launches, commercial initiatives, and editorial content

**Markting & Growth Activation**

* Deliver E-commerce revenue and margin (after marketing) vs budget through continuous optimization of traffic, conversion, AOV, and CAC
* Own and manage the marketing budget
* Build and deliver the digital marketing roadmap, campaigns and promotions across CRM, newsletters, digital advertising, and social media
* Brief and manage creative consultants to deliver compelling commercial campaigns
* Optimize paid media campaigns (Meta, Google, etc.) in close collaboration with our Paid Marketing Expert

**Customer Experience & CRM**

* Develop CRM strategies to increase loyalty and retention
* Ensure consistent brand experience across all digital touchpoints, in collaboration with our internal Commercial Team and external marketing creatives

**Performance & Reporting**

* Track and report on core E-commerce metrics including:
	+ Net Sales
	+ Orders, AOV, CVR, CAC, LTV
	+ CRM engagement (open/click rates, list growth, segmentation)
	+ Paid media performance (ROAS, CPC, CTR)
* Flag underperforming areas and propose improvements
* Support business reviews with data insights and actionable recommendations

### **The nature of the Role**


This role sits at the intersection of **digital sales performance**, **brand experience**, and **technology**. As E-commerce & CRM Lead, you’ll take end-to-end ownership of Hem’s digital store and catalogue - hem.com and pro.hem.com - driving sales, conversion, and retention online, while shaping how customers experience our brand across every digital touchpoint.  

  

The scope **blends commercial ownership with operational execution**. You’ll plan and deliver campaigns, build out journeys that convert and retain, and continuously refine CRM, site UX, and paid media to close performance gaps. At the same time, you’ll act as a bridge between commercial, brand, tech, and customer service teams - ensuring everything we put into the world is clear, intentional, and customer-focused.  

  

Success in this role means **hitting your sales targets while improving the end-to-end digital journey**. From lifecycle campaigns to conversion flows, homepage strategy to campaign landing pages, you’ll connect the dots to drive growth and elevate the Hem catalogue online.

### **About You**

* 3+ years experience in e-commerce, CRM, or digital marketing
* Strong analytical mindset and problem-solving skills - you love owning and improving KPIs
* Hands-on experience with Shopify, Klaviyo (or similar), Contentful (or similar), and paid channels (Meta/Google Ads)
* Confident acting as coordinator and brief owner towards developers and tech partners
* Familiarity with headless e-commerce architecture is a plus
* Comfortable shifting between strategy and execution
* Bonus if you have experience in design, lifestyle, or consumer brands

### **You Might Be a Fit If You:**

* Take full ownership of your sales and performance metrics
* Are a confident communicator who can align stakeholders and brief creatives with clarity
* Combine a structured, analytical mindset with strong visual and editorial sensitivity
* Thrive in a fast-paced, detail-driven environment where every pixel and percent matters
* Balance commercial ownership with operational execution - and enjoy switching between both
* Are fluent in digital tools like Shopify, Klaviyo, Contentful, Google Ads, and CRM platforms
* Have a commercial instinct and love optimizing journeys, funnels, and flows
* Take ownership, improve processes, and bring ideas to life without waiting to be asked
* Are passionate about high-end design and want to help build a global digital flagship for a progressive design brand

### **Why Join Us?**


At Hem, we believe building a progressive design brand means doing things differently — with bold ideas, high standards, and a willingness to challenge convention.  

  

Joining Hem means becoming part of a close-knit, international team that cares as much about quality and culture as it does about performance. You’ll have real ownership, the freedom to shape your area of responsibility, and the opportunity to make a visible impact as we scale our global presence.  

  

We work hard, move fast, and care deeply, about our products, our customers, and each other. If you’re excited to help shape the next chapter of a high-end design brand with global ambitions, you’ll feel right at home.

title: UX Researcher
description:
**tl;dr** You are curious, structured, and passionate about uncovering user insights. You’ve run end-to-end research that shaped real products and are ready for your next challenge. Mimo is backed with > 15m$ by leading investors like Project A & Northzone. At Mimo research drives product innovation and you’ll turn complexity into clarity, grow your craft, and help reinvent how finance & accounting is done.

**Compensation:** Market rate salary + retirement contribution + stock options + gym card  

**Holidays:** 30 days p.a.

### **The opportunity**


Mimo was founded in early 2023 because small businesses spend too much time and money on payments and financing. In 2024 we launched our end-to-end payments platform that put payments and financing on autopilot, enabling businesses to save hours per week and thousands in unnecessary fees.


Backed by leading institutional investors, Mimo is now hiring a **UX Researcher** to join a team working on automating tasks for finance professionals and accountants.

### **The role**


You will, together with designers, product managers, and engineers, **plan and run research end-to-end**. From framing the right questions, to selecting the right method, to synthesizing insights into actionable recommendations, your work will directly shape our product strategy and user experience.

### **What you will do**

* Plan, scope, and conduct both qualitative and quantitative studies
* Run interviews, surveys, usability tests, and data analysis to understand user needs
* Translate findings into clear insights and opportunities that drive product decisions and inform broader product strategy as well as business growth.
* Bridge into concept development, facilitating workshops and design thinking sessions with the team
* Ensure research findings are reflected in product concepts and solutioning
* Work independently on studies while collaborating closely with design and product

### **Skills and experience**

* 4+ years of experience in startups, product companies, or design-driven organizations
* Independent and structured in approach, with strong prioritization skills
* Skilled in choosing and applying the right research methodology for the problem
* Proven impact from research that has shaped product strategy or improved UX
* Skilled at blending qualitative insights with quantitative data (e.g. SQL, product analytics) to learn about user behavior and product impact.
* Ability to communicate insights in a compelling and actionable way
* Comfortable stretching into concept development to ensure solutions reflect user needs

### **Soft skills**

* Strong sense of ownership and curiosity
* Ability to collaborate seamlessly with product, design, and engineering
* Skilled at influencing stakeholders through clear storytelling and evidence
* Balance between detail-oriented rigor and pragmatic decision-making

### **Bonus if you have…**

* Experience working with or leading external research partners
* Experience in domains such as AI, finance, accounting, or productivity tools
* Experience facilitating cross-functional workshops at product companies

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
**tl;dr** You are experienced, user-centered, and passionate about the design craft. You’ve shaped real products end-to-end and are ready for your next big challenge. Mimo is backed with > 15m$ by leading investors like Project A & Northzone. At Mimo, design sits at the heart of innovation. Here you’ll push the frontier of design, grow your craft, and help reinvent how finance & accounting is done.

**Compensation:** Market rate salary + retirement contribution + stock options + gym card  

**Holidays:** 30 days p.a.

### **The opportunity**


Mimo was founded in early 2023 because small businesses spend too much time and money on payments and financing. In 2024 we launched our end-to-end payments platform that put payments and financing on autopilot, enabling businesses to save hours per week and thousands in unnecessary fees.


Backed by leading institutional investors, Mimo is now hiring a **Senior Product Designer** to join a team working on automating tasks for finance professionals and accountants.

### **The role**


You will, together with designers, product managers, engineers, and researchers, **design experiences end-to-end**. From early concept and discovery, through design systems and prototypes, to implementation-ready design, your work will shape how our users interact with our product. You’ll connect user needs, business goals, and vision into simple, beautiful, and effective product experiences.

### **What you will do**

* Run design projects from discovery through delivery, in close collaboration with the team
* Create engaging, user-centric experiences that balance desirability, feasibility, and viability
* Collaborate closely with PMs, engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure design intent is carried through to production
* Build and maintain design systems in Figma to enable consistency and scalability
* Prototype, test, and iterate to validate ideas and refine experiences
* Evaluating adoption, gathering feedback, and translating learnings after launch into the next iteration
* Ship designs, learn from feedback, and iterate based on insights

### **Skills and experience**

* 5+ years of experience in startups, product companies, and/or agency environments (SaaS, financial services, or AI-driven products a plus)
* User-centered design mindset with proven ways of working
* Figma “native”, with strong experience in design systems and prototyping
* Skilled at turning complexity into simple, elegant, and well-crafted experiences
* Strong communicator, able to explain the “why” behind design decisions
* Track record of delivering measurable impact through design

### **Soft skills**

* Strong sense of ownership and initiative
* Collaborative mindset, comfortable working with cross-functional partners
* Balance between craft detail and shipping value quickly
* Ability to advocate for design while staying grounded in business and technical constraints

### **Bonus if you have…**

* Experience working in SaaS, fintech, or B2B products
* Knowledge of data-heavy interfaces, dashboards, or workflow tools
* Experience designing AI-driven products or integrating machine learning in UX
* Experience facilitating workshops to align stakeholders around design outcomes

title: UI/UX designer, Västerås
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We’re hiring for one of our clients a UI/UX Designer to strengthen their design capabilities and help shape the next generation of digital products. The role focuses on creating effective interaction design patterns, applying the design system to user interface design, and ensuring usability through user research and testing. You will collaborate closely with designers, product managers, developers, and domain experts, working across teams in a complex organizational environment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
 Understand product and service design requirements and translate them into user-centered design solutions.
   

  

 Define and refine information architecture, user workflows, and interaction patterns iteratively.
   

  

 Create clear design documentation and handoff for development.
   

  

 Apply the design system in user interface design.
   

  

 Evaluate user experience and user interface design using appropriate research and evaluation methods.
   

  

 Ensure consistency, quality, and attention to detail across product and service experiences.
   

  

**Requirements:**
* Proven experience as a UI/UX Designer in digital product development with at least 5 years of experience (mid–senior level)
* Strong portfolio demonstrating interface design, interaction design, and application of design systems.
* Hands-on experience with user research and UX evaluation methods.
* Proven experience applying design systems effectively.
* Ability to work effectively in dynamic, complex environments.


**Good-to-Have:**
* Experience with industrial solutions, digital twin, or complex SaaS products.
* Degree in Interaction Design, Industrial Design, Visual Communication, Human-Computer Interaction, or related field.
* Strong collaboration, communication, and facilitation skills across diverse teams.


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Product Designer -  Installer App
description:
Are you passionate about crafting exceptional app experiences that delight its users and shape the future of clean energy? Join Aira, a pioneering Swedish tech company, and help us design the digital products that power Europe’s energy transition!
 


 About Aira
 
 Aira is at the forefront of clean energy technology. Residential heating causes 10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions, and energy bills are spiralling out of control. With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the core, we are making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable, helping Europe turn off gas and slash energy costs one home at a time.
 



 Founded in 2022 and already with 1000+ employees across Europe, Aira is on a mission to install clean energy solutions in 5 million homes by 2034. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, we are scaling fast.
 



**About the role** 




 We are now looking for a talented Senior Product Designer to join our team in Stockholm. Someone excited to design innovative tools that make complex technology easy to use. In this role, you’ll focus on shaping our internal mobile tools for installers, creating intuitive and inspiring experiences that help them bring clean energy systems to life in people’s homes. Our installer app supports the setup of the intelligent Aira Heat Pump, and will soon extend to solar, EV charging, and battery solutions.
 



 If you’re passionate about turning technical complexity into elegant simplicity and want to design tools that directly impact the energy transition, this is your opportunity to make a real difference.
   





 In this role, you will:
   




* Design responsive, user-centered interfaces following UX/UI best practices and accessibility standards.
* Build wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs that clearly communicate user flows and interactions.
* Contribute to our design system by building scalable components and style guides that ensure consistency and quality across projects.
* Support and conduct usability and prototype testing, applying insights to improve the installer's experience.
* Design and refine both new features and existing app experiences, bringing variety and continuous improvement.
* Collaborate closely with developers to ensure accurate implementation and smooth handoffs.



**What you bring to the team** 



* 7+ years of professional experience as a Product Designer, with a strong focus on app design.
* A portfolio showcasing design work on mobile apps.
* Strong understanding of usability, accessibility, and responsive design.
* Experience in design systems and component management.
* A proactive, collaborative mindset with the ability to adapt quickly.
* Proficiency in Figma and prototyping tools.
* Fluency in English (spoken and written).



**Nice to Have:** 



* Experience working in agile teams.
* Experience designing complex digital products, with the ability to grasp technical aspects and translate them into intuitive, user-friendly interfaces



**What is in it for you?** 



* Be part of a fast-growing scale-up with a clear mission and real impact on Europe’s clean energy transition.
* Contribute to impactful app design that reaches thousands of users
* You’ll work side by side with senior designers and our lead designer, receiving regular feedback and mentorship to sharpen your skills and grow your craft.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy the flexibility of our hybrid work model and discover our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes' walk away



 At Aira, we champion the next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Content Strategist
description:
◦ Tasks: Produce and manage blogs, newsletters, whitepapers, and case studies; develop an editorial calendar; translate complex AI/penetration-testing concepts into clear, engaging content; ensure SEO best practices; collaborate with engineers and pen testers for technical accuracy.
 



  





 ◦ Required Competencies: Excellent written communication; cybersecurity and AI domain knowledge; content planning; SEO; interviewing skills; familiarity with publishing platforms.

title: Webbdesigner - timanställning
description:
Vill du vara med och skapa Sveriges mest användarvänliga vårdupplevelse online?
   

  

 Hos oss på Svea KBT / Elly Care får du arbeta med design och digitala upplevelser som faktiskt påverkar människors liv — på riktigt.
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 Som Webbdesigner blir du en nyckelperson i hur människor upplever vår digitala närvaro. Din uppgift är att skapa webbsidor som inte bara ser fantastiska ut — utan också känns intuitiva, tillgängliga och engagerande.
   

  

 Du kommer bland annat att:
   

  

* Designa användarvänliga webbsidor med hög visuell kvalitet


 Skapa moderna UI- och UX-lösningar i Figma — från idé till färdig design
   

  

* Självständigt bygga sidor i WordPress och Gutenberg
* Samarbeta med marknads-, kommunikations- och utvecklingsteam för att skapa helhetsupplevelser som driver konvertering och engagemang
* Bidra till vår designstrategi och sätta en hög standard för form och funktion


 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

 Tekniska färdigheter
   

  

* Mycket god känsla för design och form — du vet hur en riktigt bra webbsida ska se ut och kännas
* Stark förståelse för UX och UI
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Figma — du arbetar effektivt och självständigt i verktyget
* God vana att bygga sidor i WordPress och Gutenberg
* Mycket goda kunskaper i HTML och CSS
* Förmåga att kommunicera tydligt och arbeta med flera stakeholders samtidigt


 Personliga egenskaper
   

  

* Du är strukturerad och effektiv i ditt arbete
* Du har ett öga för detaljer men tappar aldrig bort helheten
* Du är kommunikativ, prestigelös och gillar att samarbeta
* Du trivs i en miljö där det händer mycket och där din insats märks


 Det är ett plus om du också:
   

  

* Är duktig på annan typ av design, t.ex. sociala medier, nyhetsbrev eller trycksaker
* Kan enklare frontendkodning utöver HTML/CSS (t.ex. JavaScript)


 Arbetsprov kommer att vara en del av rekryteringsprocessen
   

  

 Som en del i rekryteringsprocessen kommer kandidater att få utföra arbetsprover. Vi vill också se tidigare arbetsprover som du har gjort. Inkludera därför minst 3 hemsidor som du har designat själv. Beskriv noggrannt vad du har gjort på varje hemsida och vad som var målet med designen.
   

  

 Om Svea KBT & Elly Care
   

  

 Vi är en av Sveriges mest snabbväxande aktörer inom psykisk hälsa. Vår mission är att skapa Bästa patientresan — en vårdupplevelse som är sömlös, empatisk och effektiv.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med KBT, psykologisk behandling och NPF-utredningar, både fysiskt och digitalt.
   

  

 Som Webbdesigner hos oss hjälper du människor att hitta rätt hjälp i rätt tid — genom genomtänkt design och smarta digitala lösningar.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder
   

  

* En varm, prestigelös och kreativ arbetskultur
* Flexibilitet i arbetstid och arbetsplats
* Möjlighet att påverka designstrategin och skapa verklig samhällsnytta
* Ett engagerat team som gillar att testa nytt, dela kunskap och bygga något viktigt tillsammans


 Praktisk information
   

  

* Anställningsform: Timanställning - det är inte aktuellt med fakturering eller frilansarbete. Endast timanställning är aktuellt.
* Omfattning: Enligt överenskommelse
* Ort: Stockholm (distansarbete kan förekomma)
* Kontakt: patrik.bergqvist@sveakbt.se felix.israelsson@sveakbt.se
* Ansökan: Skicka gärna in så snart som möjligt – urval sker löpande
* Bifoga: Exempel på webbplatser och designprojekt du arbetat med (gärna i Figma eller WordPress)

With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the core, we are making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable, helping Europe turn off gas and slash energy costs one home at a time.

title: Senior Visual Designer & Content Creator
description:
Certan söker en 
 **Visual Content Producer** 
  som vill vara med och forma hur ett av Sveriges mest vetenskapsdrivna varumärken inom hälsa och prestation upplevs visuellt.
 



  





 Du kommer att arbeta nära vår Head of Brand och vara den som förverkligar vår visuella strategi – från koncept till färdig produktion. Rollen kräver både kreativ precision och teknisk skicklighet.
 



  





 Du ska kunna ta ett projekt hela vägen: fota, filma, redigera och skapa visuellt material som håller högsta nivå på sociala medier, YouTube och i digitala kampanjer.

 Vi söker dig som:
 


* Förstår hur man bygger varumärkesidentitet genom visuellt uttryck

* Är självgående, snabb och levererar med kvalitet i varje detalj

 Du blir en central del av Certans kreativa team och en nyckelperson i hur vi fortsätter växa och differentiera oss genom kunskap, design och vetenskaplig trovärdighet.
 



  





 Mejla: ansokning@certan.se med portfolio eller tidigare projekt.

title: Experienced Designer, UX, Kyndryl Vital, Nordics & Baltics
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 The Role
   

  

 At Kyndryl Vital, UX Designers craft intuitive and user-centered digital experiences that solve real human problems through thoughtful interface design, interaction patterns, and information architecture. This role focuses on creating products that are not only visually appealing but also usable, accessible, and valuable to end-users. Through user research, wireframing, prototyping, and usability testing, UX Designers ensure that digital solutions meet both user needs and business objectives.
   

  

 As a specialist and leader in UX design, you will:
   

  

* Lead UX initiatives across various projects, ensuring interfaces are intuitive, accessible, and aligned with client objectives
* Conduct user research to identify pain points, behaviors, and opportunities for design innovation
* Create user personas, journey maps, and information architecture that inform design decisions
* Develop wireframes, prototypes, and interaction patterns that effectively communicate design concepts
* Facilitate design workshops and user testing sessions to validate design solutions
* Build and maintain strong client relationships, serving as a trusted UX advisor throughout the project lifecycle
* Guide design teams in creating cohesive user experiences across multiple touchpoints and platforms
* Collaborate with developers and product managers to balance user needs with technical feasibility
* Advocate for user-centered design principles throughout the organization
* Own the UX process from discovery and ideation to testing and implementation


 Required Technical and Professional Expertise
   

  

* User-Centered Design: You have a deep understanding of UX methodologies, including user personas, journey mapping, and information architecture.
* Interaction Design: You can create intuitive user flows, navigation patterns, and micro-interactions that enhance usability across digital products.
* Usability Testing: You excel at designing and facilitating usability tests to validate design decisions and identify opportunities for improvement.
* Wireframing & Prototyping: You can create low to high-fidelity prototypes using industry tools like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD to communicate design concepts effectively.
* User Research: You can plan and conduct both qualitative and quantitative research to uncover user needs, behaviors, and pain points.
* Information Architecture: You have expertise in organizing and structuring complex information to create intuitive navigation systems.
* Accessibility: You understand WCAG guidelines and design inclusive experiences that work for users of all abilities.
* Collaboration: You work effectively with developers, product managers, and stakeholders to translate business requirements into user-friendly solutions.
* UI Design Principles: You have strong knowledge of visual hierarchy, typography, and responsive design to create aesthetically pleasing interfaces.
* UX Writing: You can craft clear, concise microcopy that guides users through digital experiences.
* Co-Creation: You excel at aligning stakeholders through workshops and collaborative sessions.
* Storytelling: You can communicate clearly and compellingly.
* Design with and for AI: You leverage AI tools while maintaining quality and ethical standards.


**Who You Are**
 Preferred Professional and Technical Expertise
   

  

* 8+ years experience
* Deep industry vertical experience
* Experience in both enterprise and agency worlds
* Knowledge and experience in IT infrastructure or other technical applications
* Human behavior, change management, or other applied social sciences
* Data science, AI/ML background


 Required Education
   

  

* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent portfolio


**Preferred Education**
* MDM, MDes, MFA, dMBA or equivalent


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Digital AI Designer & Retoucher
description:
**About Photowall** 

 At Photowall, we are more than just a global leader in custom-made wallpapers and wall murals. We’re passionate about transforming spaces and bringing design to life. With a presence in over 20 markets, we’re on an exciting journey of growth. Our vision is to keep expanding, both geographically and through innovative new products. As proud members of the Network of Design (NOD), we are constantly pushing the boundaries of interior design to create inspiring and meaningful spaces. At Photowall, we offer a dynamic, fast-paced environment where personal growth and development are key.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As AI Digital Designer at Photowall, you will play a vital role in our mission to continue revolutionizing wall décor. Your work will directly impact our growth, as you collaborate with passionate teams to enhance our products and strengthen our presence as leaders in the world of wallpaper and interior design.
 



 You’ll create and edit AI-generated room interiors and visual assets, bringing our wallpapers and designs to life across e-commerce, organic social and paid channels. Your visuals will inspire customers, support campaigns and elevate our brand storytelling. A strong passion for interior design, an eye for trends and a love for exploring new AI tools will help you thrive in this role.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Create AI-generated interiors and visual assets for e-commerce, organic social media, and paid social campaigns for both D2C and B2B.
* Develop visual storytelling that engages customers and strengthens Photowall’s brand identity across digital platforms.
* Generate high-quality, on-brand imagery using AI tools to ensure a cohesive and inspiring look and feel.
* Serve as the main in-house retoucher for all AI-generated and photographed images, ensuring a cohesive and high-quality visual standard
* Collaborate closely with the Brand & Creative Studio and Digital Marketing to ensure visuals perform well across all touchpoints.
* Stay up to date with interior and design trends, ensuring our content feels fresh, modern, and relevant.
* Work efficiently and independently, balancing creative exploration with consistent content delivery.


**Requirements** 
* Expert and professional track record in generative AI tools with a strong passion for exploring new creative possibilities
* Strong, professional-level experience with AI image and video tools. Able to create both still and motion content using AI.
* Proven experience creating storytelling visuals for digital platforms.
* Deep interest in design, interiors, and visual culture, with a strong aesthetic sense.
* Expert in Adobe Creative Suite, confident in advanced retouching and post-production workflows.
* Collaborative mindset and ability to thrive in a fast-paced e-commerce environment.


**It’s a plus if you** 
* Have a strong creative background prior to becoming an AI designer, preferably as a Photographer, Videographer or Art Director.
* Have an interest in analytics and how data can inform creative decisions.



  





**Why Photowall** 




 At Photowall, we’re a close-knit team that values creativity, collaboration, and growth. You’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of visual content in a company that’s passionate about design and innovation. As part of the Network of Design (NOD), we constantly explore new ways to merge creativity and technology.
 
 Apply today!
 




  





 If you’re an AI designer with a love for interiors and a sharp eye for design trends, this is your chance to join a brand that’s shaping the future of wall design.
 



  





 Please include your CV and portfolio (PDF or website). Applications without a portfolio will not be reviewed. The selection process is ongoing, and the position will be filled once we find the right candidate.

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Type:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**About The Role**
 You’ll join an ambitious AI-driven legal & compliance start up that’s building next-generation workflow platforms. The company is looking for a talented Frontend Engineer to bring their UI/UX vision to life. You’ll work closely with design and backend teams to craft elegant, intuitive, high-performance web applications that deliver complex AI capabilities through seamless and delightful user interfaces.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Develop and maintain user-facing features in a modern web application built around advanced AI for legal & compliance workflows
* Translate UI/UX and design specifications into high-quality, responsive and interactive frontend code
* Collaborate with backend engineers to integrate APIs and deliver robust, scalable features
* Build reusable component libraries, optimise performance and troubleshoot frontend issues to ensure a reliable user experience
* Shape the frontend architecture and contribute to the product’s evolution and global ambition


 Who You Are
   

  

* Proficient in HTML, CSS and modern TypeScript
* Experienced with at least one modern JavaScript framework (e.g., React, Vue, Angular)
* Detail-oriented, with a strong sense for user-friendly, responsive interface design
* Passionate about building polished user experiences and comfortable working independently in a fast-paced, start up environment
* Bonus: You have experience with data visualisation or handling complex interfaces


 If this role is of interest please apply - relocation support not provided

title: UX-lead till försvarskund
description:
Vill du ta nästa steg i karriären och samtidigt bidra till samhällsutveckling?
   

  

 Ta då chansen att söka rollen som UX-lead i ett långsiktigt uppdrag hos en av våra försvarskunder!
   

  

 Som konsult hos Nexer får du en trygg och långsiktig anställning, samtidigt som du får möjlighet att utvecklas i uppdrag som gör verklig skillnad. Vi tror på hållbar kompetensutveckling, balans i livet och att du ska få växa både professionellt och som person.
   

  

**Om uppdraget**
 Uppdraget genomförs hos en offentlig aktör med ansvar för verksamhetskritiska IT-stöd. Organisationen befinner sig i ett större förändringsarbete där både systemmiljö och arbetssätt utvecklas, och du får en nyckelroll i att forma användarupplevelsen för framtidens lösningar.
   

  

 Som UX-strateg leder du arbetet med att etablera en övergripande strategi för UX och användarcentrerad design. Du definierar vision, mål och riktlinjer, involverar användare och verksamhetsrepresentanter, och säkerställer att designprinciper för tillgänglighet, användarupplevelse och teknik genomsyrar hela utvecklingsprocessen.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära arkitekter, frontendutvecklare och UX-designers i ett tvärfunktionellt team, och bidrar till att skapa moderna, hållbara lösningar som gör skillnad för många användare.
   

  

 Uppdraget är i Enköping och du förväntas arbeta på plats fem dagar i veckan.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror att du är en person som trivs i komplexa miljöer där samarbete, struktur och kommunikation är avgörande. Du är strategisk, lyhörd och har förmågan att omsätta verksamhetskrav till konkreta designprinciper. Du är van att leda UX-arbete i stora organisationer och har ett genuint intresse för att skapa lösningar som är både funktionella och användarvänliga.
   

  

 där du byggt upp en gedigen förståelse för användarbeteenden, designprinciper och verksamhetsnära behov.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:**
* Minst åtta års arbetserfarenhet av UX (User Experience).
* Minst fem års erfarenhet av ledande roll inom utveckling av UX.
* Minst fem års erfarenhet av att tolka verksamhetskrav och omsätta till UX-design utifrån designprinciper för bl.a. användarupplevelse, tillgänglighet, design och teknik.
* Kunskap om och erfarenhet av att tillämpa ledande designmetodik och research.
* Erfarenhet av agil arbetsmetodik.
* Utvecklat minst en UX strategi med intressenter från flera verksamhetsområden i en organisation med minst 5000 användare.


 Rollen kräver att du kan kommunicera obehindrat på svenska i både tal och skrift samt att du har svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

**Om Nexer Public Sales**
 Affärsområdet Public Sales på Nexer har lång erfarenhet av att driva och utveckla uppdrag inom offentlig sektor – myndigheter, regioner och kommuner. Nu tar vi nästa steg och stärker vår närvaro i Mälardalsregionen. Hos oss får du inte bara arbeta med samhällsviktiga uppdrag – du får också vara med och påverka, forma kulturen och bygga upp något tillsammans med oss.
   

  

**Ansökan**
**OBS. Kort ansökningsdatum! Sista ansökningsdag är 5 november.**
 Välkommen att söka tjänsten genom att skicka in din ansökan här nedan. Enligt GDPR hanterar vi inte ansökningar via e-post, men har du frågor om tjänsten eller Nexer är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare, Xie Gamboa, på xie.gamboa@nexergroup.com.

title: IT Support Engineer
description:
**IT Support Engineer (Mid–Senior) - EMEA (London or Stockholm)**


**Location:**  

Remote (London or Stockholm preferred) - occasional onsite support for the local office.


**Department:** IT  

  

**Reports To:** Security/IT Manager  

  

**Employment Type:** Full-Time


**About Channel Factory**



Channel Factory is a global technology and data platform that helps advertisers and agencies build brand-suitable, contextually aligned ad strategies. Our IT team supports a distributed, cloud-first workforce across North America, EMEA, and APAC - focused on seamless user experience, automation, and secure device management.


**Role Overview**



The EMEA IT Support Engineer plays a key role in supporting our European workforce, managing devices, and ensuring smooth day-to-day operations. You’ll be the go-to contact for EMEA users, balancing technical troubleshooting with systems administration and contributing to global IT initiatives.


**Key Responsibilities**


Provide Tier 2/3 technical support for end users in your region via Jira Service Management.  

* 
* Manage and maintain the **macOS fleet** through Jamf Pro, including enrollment, compliance, and patch management.
* Support **Google Workspace** administration (user lifecycle, mail routing, permissions, and group management).
* Administer **SSO/MFA** platforms (OneLogin or similar) — user provisioning and application assignments.
* Coordinate **hardware logistics** for your region — procurement, shipping, RMA, and local vendor management.
* Collaborate with global IT teams to ensure **follow-the-sun** coverage and consistent standards.

Maintain asset records and documentation in our IT systems.  
* 
* Participate in global projects (automation, onboarding/offboarding improvements, and process documentation).
  


**Requirements**


4+ years in IT Support, Service Desk, or Systems Administration.  

* 

Strong macOS expertise (Jamf Pro, ABM/DEP).  
* 

Hands-on experience with Google Workspace and SSO/MFA platforms.  
* 

Familiarity with networking fundamentals (DNS, VPN, etc.).  
* 

Excellent communication skills and ability to work across time zones.  
* 
* (Preferred) Experience with automation/scripting (Python).
  


**Nice to Have**


Exposure to endpoint security tools or SOAR automation.  

* 

Experience in a global, remote-first environment.  
* 
* Familiarity with Slack or Atlassian administration.

title: DTC Tech - Staff Software Engineer
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***

**Who We Are…**

When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the *storytellers* bringing our characters to life, the *creators* bringing them to your living rooms and the *dreamers* creating what’s next…


From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

  

Warner Bros. has been entertaining audiences for more than 90 years through the world’s most-loved characters and franchises. Warner Bros. employs people all over the world in a wide variety of disciplines. We're always on the lookout for energetic, creative people to join our team.

**Who We Are…**


When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the *storytellers* bringing our characters to life, the *creators* bringing them to your living rooms and the *dreamers* creating what’s next…


From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

**About Warner Bros. Discovery:**


Warner Bros. Discovery, a premier global media and entertainment company, offers audiences the world's most differentiated and complete portfolio of content, brands and franchises across television, film, streaming and gaming. The new company combines Warner Media’s premium entertainment, sports and news assets with Discovery's leading non-fiction and international entertainment and sports businesses.


For more information, please visit www.wbd.com

**What you’ll do:**


As a Platform Engineer, you will design and build a cloud based custom Observability Platform, leveraging software-driven approaches to tackle complex, data-intensive challenges. This platform is a core engineering system that empowers the engineering community with advanced tools and capabilities to troubleshoot, optimize, and gain deeper insights into their services.


Within Platform engineering, you will bring in engineering practices such as Infrastructure as Code (IaC), Site Reliability Engineering (SRE), DevOps, and automated pipelines, ensuring the platform is reliable, scalable, and easy to adopt. You will collaborate with service teams across the organization to shape adoption, define standards, and improve platform capabilities.


Within our organization, you’ll lead efforts aimed at scaling our existing operational data offerings and establish the technical strategy for how we can better equip engineers and leaders with operational intelligence. You’ll build a deep understanding of our digital streaming service and use that knowledge, coupled with your engineering, infrastructure, data and cloud knowledge, to optimize and evolve how we understand our technical ecosystem. To be successful, you’ll need to be deeply technical and capable of holding your own with other strong peers. You possess excellent collaboration and diplomacy skills. An ideal candidate will be a creative thinker and passionate about technology as well as drive innovation and produce delightful experiences for customers. This person will demonstrate data-driven open minded decision making, have an insatiable curiosity, love to invent and innovate to solve difficult challenges in a fast-paced global environment. If you love solving problems at scale, prefer to build scalable, reliable, and testable software to automate infrastructure management, are an ace troubleshooter, and are deeply technical, then this is the role for you!

**Roles & Responsibilities:**

* You work on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors. You play a leading role on the team to design and develop major functional changes to existing software systems, or new ones.
* You create functional-level impact and deliver more complex functional changes. You implement activities that generally impact multiple components, processes, your own work, and other units, teams, and projects.
* You design components and complex architectures while solving business problems with simple and straightforward solutions, applying appropriate technologies and software engineering best practices. You lead the design and development of the most complex enhancements.
* You build multiple stable, scalable feature changes that can be successfully shipped to customers in production. Your software contributions in production are the model for highly available, low latency, and efficient software.
* You are a collaborative leader that makes other engineers and team members around you more productive by sharing your knowledge and helping to drive technical decisions. You can communicate complicated concepts simply.
* You drive best practices and set standards for your team. You are a role model for your teams. Your software contributions in production are the model for highly available, low latency, and efficient software.
* You are expected to mentor other engineers on your team.

**What to Bring:**

* At least 9 - 14 years of overall experience in software, systems, and infrastructure.
* At least 6 years of experience managing public cloud infrastructure with AWS, including design, implementation, and maintenance of large scale environments.
* Experience with a variety of cloud services like OpenSearch, AMP, Kinesis, network, storage etc.
* Must have CS fundamentals and a track record of implementing highly reliable automation using any scripting or programming language such as Python/Go.
* Strong knowledge and implementation history of Terraform and/or other similar tooling.
* Deep understanding of distributed systems, microservice architecture, kafka, logging/metric/tracing platforms (ELK, Prometheus, Grafana, OTEL etc), and security.
* Experience with container orchestration technologies such as Kubernetes or AWS EKS is strongly desired.
* Experience in working across product, engineering, and analytics teams to evaluate new ideas, discuss technical concepts, create scalable designs, implement new models, and make tradeoffs to remove roadblocks

**What We Offer:**

* A Great Place to work
* Equal opportunity employer
* Fast track growth opportunities


On June 9, 2025, Warner Bros. Discovery announced plans to separate into two publicly traded companies, Warner Bros. and Discovery Global, with an expected completion in mid-2026. For more details, including leadership appointments and information on individual brands, please visit our newsroom here.


Although you will be hired by Warner Bros. Discovery, upon the planned separation in 2026, your employment likely will transition to Warner Bros. Company. During this period of transformation, you’ll have an exciting opportunity to lay the foundation at one of the world’s premier entertainment brands.

**How We Get Things Done…**


This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**


Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.


If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our accessibility page for instructions to submit your request.

**How We Get Things Done…**


This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**


Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our accessibility page for instructions to submit your request.

title: DTC Tech - Staff Software Engineer
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***

**Who We Are…**

When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the *storytellers* bringing our characters to life, the *creators* bringing them to your living rooms and the *dreamers* creating what’s next…


From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

  

Warner Bros. has been entertaining audiences for more than 90 years through the world’s most-loved characters and franchises. Warner Bros. employs people all over the world in a wide variety of disciplines. We're always on the lookout for energetic, creative people to join our team.

**Who We Are…**


When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the *storytellers* bringing our characters to life, the *creators* bringing them to your living rooms and the *dreamers* creating what’s next…


From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

**About Warner Bros. Discovery:**


Warner Bros. Discovery, a premier global media and entertainment company, offers audiences the world's most differentiated and complete portfolio of content, brands and franchises across television, film, streaming and gaming. The new company combines Warner Media’s premium entertainment, sports and news assets with Discovery's leading non-fiction and international entertainment and sports businesses.


For more information, please visit www.wbd.com

**What you’ll do:**


As a Platform Engineer, you will design and build a cloud based custom Observability Platform, leveraging software-driven approaches to tackle complex, data-intensive challenges. This platform is a core engineering system that empowers the engineering community with advanced tools and capabilities to troubleshoot, optimize, and gain deeper insights into their services.


Within Platform engineering, you will bring in engineering practices such as Infrastructure as Code (IaC), Site Reliability Engineering (SRE), DevOps, and automated pipelines, ensuring the platform is reliable, scalable, and easy to adopt. You will collaborate with service teams across the organization to shape adoption, define standards, and improve platform capabilities.


Within our organization, you’ll lead efforts aimed at scaling our existing operational data offerings and establish the technical strategy for how we can better equip engineers and leaders with operational intelligence. You’ll build a deep understanding of our digital streaming service and use that knowledge, coupled with your engineering, infrastructure, data and cloud knowledge, to optimize and evolve how we understand our technical ecosystem. To be successful, you’ll need to be deeply technical and capable of holding your own with other strong peers. You possess excellent collaboration and diplomacy skills. An ideal candidate will be a creative thinker and passionate about technology as well as drive innovation and produce delightful experiences for customers. This person will demonstrate data-driven open minded decision making, have an insatiable curiosity, love to invent and innovate to solve difficult challenges in a fast-paced global environment. If you love solving problems at scale, prefer to build scalable, reliable, and testable software to automate infrastructure management, are an ace troubleshooter, and are deeply technical, then this is the role for you!

**Roles & Responsibilities:**

* You work on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors. You play a leading role on the team to design and develop major functional changes to existing software systems, or new ones.
* You create functional-level impact and deliver more complex functional changes. You implement activities that generally impact multiple components, processes, your own work, and other units, teams, and projects.
* You design components and complex architectures while solving business problems with simple and straightforward solutions, applying appropriate technologies and software engineering best practices. You lead the design and development of the most complex enhancements.
* You build multiple stable, scalable feature changes that can be successfully shipped to customers in production. Your software contributions in production are the model for highly available, low latency, and efficient software.
* You are a collaborative leader that makes other engineers and team members around you more productive by sharing your knowledge and helping to drive technical decisions. You can communicate complicated concepts simply.
* You drive best practices and set standards for your team. You are a role model for your teams. Your software contributions in production are the model for highly available, low latency, and efficient software.
* You are expected to mentor other engineers on your team.

**What to Bring:**

* At least 9 - 14 years of overall experience in software, systems, and infrastructure.
* At least 6 years of experience managing public cloud infrastructure with AWS, including design, implementation, and maintenance of large scale environments.
* Experience with a variety of cloud services like OpenSearch, AMP, Kinesis, network, storage etc.
* Must have CS fundamentals and a track record of implementing highly reliable automation using any scripting or programming language such as Python/Go.
* Strong knowledge and implementation history of Terraform and/or other similar tooling.
* Deep understanding of distributed systems, microservice architecture, kafka, logging/metric/tracing platforms (ELK, Prometheus, Grafana, OTEL etc), and security.
* Experience with container orchestration technologies such as Kubernetes or AWS EKS is strongly desired.
* Experience in working across product, engineering, and analytics teams to evaluate new ideas, discuss technical concepts, create scalable designs, implement new models, and make tradeoffs to remove roadblocks

**What We Offer:**

* A Great Place to work
* Equal opportunity employer
* Fast track growth opportunities


On June 9, 2025, Warner Bros. Discovery announced plans to separate into two publicly traded companies, Warner Bros. and Discovery Global, with an expected completion in mid-2026. For more details, including leadership appointments and information on individual brands, please visit our newsroom here.

During this period of transformation, you’ll have an exciting opportunity to lay the foundation at one of the world’s premier entertainment brands.
